title: rustc hangs on this particular invalid `if let` syntax

labels.name: A-parser
labels.description: Area: The parsing of Rust source code to an AST.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: I-hang
labels.description: Issue: The compiler never terminates, due to infinite loops, deadlock, livelock, etc.

body:
The following code causes rustc to hang, consuming 100% CPU on one core, and unbounded memory until it is killed by the OOM killer:

    fn main() {                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
        let condition = Some(true);                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
        (if let Some(x) = condition) && x {                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
            println!("condition is present and true");                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
        }                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
    }                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          

This is the output from `cargo run`:

    error: expected `{`, found `)`
     --> src/main.rs:4:32
      |
    4 |     (if let Some(x) = condition) && x {
      |                                ^ expected `{`

    error: expected expression, found `<eof>`
     --> src/main.rs:7:1
      |
    7 | }
      | ^ expected expression

    error: Could not compile `cargo-hang`.

    Caused by:
      process didn't exit successfully: `rustc --edition=2018 --crate-name cargo_hang src/main.rs --color always --crate-type bin --emit=dep-info,link -C debuginfo=2 -C metadata=dc0bce50f50f460f -C extra-filename=-dc0bce50f50f460f --out-dir /home/lombard/projects/sw/cargo-hang/target/debug/deps -C incremental=/home/lombard/projects/sw/cargo-hang/target/debug/incremental -L dependency=/home/lombard/projects/sw/cargo-hang/target/debug/deps` (signal: 9, SIGKILL: kill)
